author: cnbc.com
title: Williams-Sonoma: Fiscal 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) _ Williams-Sonoma Inc. (WSM) on Wednesday reported fiscal first-quarter profit of $45.2 million.
On a per-share basis, the San Francisco-based company said it had net income of 54 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 67 cents per share.
The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 14 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 57 cents per share.
The seller of cookware and home furnishings posted revenue of $1.2 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.16 billion.
For the current quarter ending in August, Williams-Sonoma expects its per-share earnings to range from 65 cents to 70 cents.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $1.25 billion to $1.27 billion for the fiscal second quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $1.24 billion.
Williams-Sonoma expects full-year earnings in the range of $4.15 to $4.25 per share, with revenue ranging from $5.5 billion to $5.66 billion.
Williams-Sonoma shares have dropped nearly 5 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $49.19, climbing slightly in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on WSM at https://www.zacks.com/ap/WSM
